lexUnit.name: approach.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: come near or nearer to in distance, time, or standard.

sentence.text: The few Marxists who devoted serious attention to the problem of nationality and nationalism -- above all , Otto Bauer and Karl Renner -- also approached it from a class standpoint .
Daniel approached her from behind and unwound her arms and substituted his own .

She herself would use the back staircase as the entrance to her flat , approaching it from the courtyard .
A relatively strong force of fighters approached Malta on 11 April , apparently as cover for a Luftwaffe reconnaissance aircraft .
As he approaches the city on the freeway the same old restless excitement stirs in him that he felt on that first apocalyptic evening all those years ago .

He came back a couple of weeks ago and this time approached me rather than Rex .

In their work with children , Bettelheim and Zelan would approach a problem by asking What is the child feeling and what is its importance ?

As he approached his office , anxiety began to gnaw at his innards because in recent days David had found his concentration more and more fragmented .
I did not know what to do or where to go , so I approached a very nice policeman , told him I was from the country and asked which gate I should use .
He did not approach his wife , but stood looking at her .

Her heart thumped a little as she approached Hilda 's house .
She approached her home again , and entered noisily and tearfully .
After watching several performances he approached Ray and asked to paint his portrait .
But as I approached home , I was filled with a sense of shame , of uncertainty about how Mum would react when I told her .

Today we approached from the most picturesque direction , through a stile set in the wall of the narrow stone bridge whose elegant arches span the burn 's deep-cut ravine .

Guided by the agent , the pair approached with extreme caution , using the trees for cover , until they emerged from the tree-line above the valley .

Now I can exactly see the shape and size , the perfect fit , of the loneliness that is approaching .
